content: dk weight vanilla socks by kay litton supplies list yarn 100 grams of dk weight yarn sample knit in mandi s makings on her dk weight base in the colorway daydreamin 75% superwash ◊ merino 25% nylon full skein 100 grams/245 yards needles us 3/3 25mm your choice dpns magic loop using a 32 cable 9 circular pattern is not written for a specific way of working in the round notions stitch marker tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge approx 7 sts per inch in stockinette dk weight vanilla socks // © crazy sock lady designs 1 for help please contact kay at crazysockladydesigns@gmail com abbreviations/stitch glossary st stitch k2tog knit 2 stitches together co cast on p2tog purl 2 stitches together k knit ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knitwise one at a time then knit the 2 slipped stitches together through p purl the back loop sl slip_stitch *slip stitches purlwise with yarn in back instep - front/top of the sock unless otherwise noted* sole - back/bottom of the sock sizes pattern is written for small medium large a note on sizes circumference 8-9 9-10 10-11 the sizes listed are based on the foot circumference *tip highlight the size you need throughout the and not the foot length pattern to avoid any confusion i recommend choosing a size that will allow for 1-2 inches of negative ease to get the best fit you will knit the sock to the length that you need in order to fit notes on pattern this pattern is written for dk weight yarn but you can also use fingering weight yarn held double to achieve this weight i did this when knitting up the size large to test the pattern and used approx 110 grams of fingering weight total for a mens us size 10 this is a great and fun way to use up some leftover bits of yarn and have a fun marled pair of scrappy socks or grab two fingering weight skeins out of your stash and use them up so many fun stash busting possibilities when holding fingering weight double for these socks dk weight vanilla socks // © crazy sock lady designs 2 for help please contact kay at crazysockladydesigns@gmail com pattern cuff gusset co 40 48 56 sts k across the first 6 7 8 stitches of the heel turn and i use the german twisted cast on place a marker this will now be the beginning of your round you can find a tutorial for this cast on here k across the last 6 7 8 stitches of the heel turn https //youtu be/w9cddclkw7m and then pick up 10 12 14 stitches along the rounds 1-10 k2 p2 repeat around side of the heel flap pick up 1 extra stitch in the ladder in the row below leg k across the instep stitches round 1 -- 29 knit around pick up 1 extra stitch in the ladder in the row below round 30 k
